glsa.title: Cyrus-SASL: Denial of service
glsa.synopsis: A NULL pointer dereference in Cyrus-SASL may allow remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: Cyrus-SASL is an implementation of the Simple Authentication and Security Layer.

description.p: In the GNU C Library (glibc) from version 2.17 onwards, the crypt() function call can return NULL when the salt violates specifications or the system is in FIPS-140 mode and a DES or MD5 hashed password is passed. When Cyrus-SASLâ€™s authentication mechanisms call crypt(), a NULL may be returned.

impact.p: A remote attacker could trigger this vulnerability to cause a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
